titles.title: Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: That it shall be in order for the Speaker to entertain motions to suspend the rules on Saturday, November 18, 1995. The object of such motion to suspend the rules must be announced one hour prior to its consideration.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-351, by Mr. McInnis.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 129.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on H. Res. 275.
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on H. Res. 275.

WORDS TAKEN DOWN - During the course of debate, Mr. Hoyer demanded that certain words spoken by Mr. Mica be taken down. The words were taken down and reported to the House and were deemed to be unparliamentary. Mr. Delay moved to permit Mr. Mica to proceed in order. The Chair put the question on the motion and annouced that, by voice vote, the motion was not agreed to. Mr. Linder objected to the vote on grounds that a quorum was not present and made a point of order that a quorum was not present. Accordingly, the Yeas and Nays were ordered.
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on the resolution.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 247 - 169 (Roll no. 817).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/17/1995--Introduced. Makes it in order at any time on November 18, 1995, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules, provided that the object of any such motion is announced from the House floor at least one hour before its consideration.
